item.title: Forest agree Ortega deal and target Inter's Frattesi
item.description: Nottingham Forest agree a deal for Manchester City goalkeeper Stefan Ortega worth up to £500,000.

item.title: I never stopped believing - Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Leeds striker Dominic Calvert-Lewin sits down with BBC Sport's Betty Glover to talk about his return to goalscoring form, being a free agent and his England chances.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: How Fernandez has become key player for Chelsea
item.description: The stats that show how World Cup winner Enzo Fernandez is one of, if not the, most important players in Chelsea's attack.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v boxer Francesca Hennessy
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Francesca Hennessy and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: What's meant for you won't pass you by - Calvert-Lewin
item.description: Dominic Calvert-Lewin discusses the loneliness he experienced while waiting for a transfer this summer and how his form since joining Leeds has re-ignited his England hopes.

item.title: 'I had to keep believing' - Wirtz on early Liverpool struggles
item.description: Midfielder Florian Wirtz opens up about his move to Liverpool and how he dealt with his struggles earlier on this season.

item.title: Cologne survive Wolfsburg pressure to earn narrow win
item.description: Cologne beat Wolfsburg 1-0 with a first-half strike from midfielder Linton Maina and survive a flurry of late chances for the visitors at RheinEnergieStadion.

item.title: 'You become more of a man' - Ferguson on life in Italy
item.description: Bologna midfielder Lewis Ferguson discusses the World Cup, learning Italian, a positional change at club level and Hamilton Academical's plight.

item.title: Eat & Yap - Man City's Kerstin Casparij meets Alex Scott
item.description: Manchester City's exciting full-back Kerstin Casparij answers Alex Scott's quickfire questions in BBC Sport's new Eat & Yap series.

item.title: Snoop Dogg aiming to make Swansea a 'global name'
item.description: Rapper Snoop Dogg says he wants to play his part in making Swansea City become a "global name".

item.title: Are Arsenal fans making team nervous in title race?
item.description: Is a nervousness among Arsenal fans affecting the players in the Premier League title race? Alex Howell looks at what impact this could have on Mikel Arteta's side as they look to end a run of three second-placed finishes.

item.title: Inter want Liverpool's Jones on loan - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Curtis Jones is attracting interest from Serie A side Inter Milan, while Gabriel Jesus and Gabriel Martinelli could be on their way to La Liga. However, Joshua Zirkzee looks like he may now stay in the Premier League, plus more.

item.title: Carrick not ruling out Man Utd deadline day moves
item.description: Manchester United's interim head coach Michael Carrick is not ruling out the possibility of the club doing business on transfer deadline day

item.title: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
item.description: Benfica will face Real Madrid in the Champions League play-offs just three weeks after their dramatic league phase encounter.

item.title: Mateta 'not in right place' to play against Forest
item.description: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta is "not in the right place" to play against Nottingham Forest as he continues to be linked with a move away, says Oliver Glasner.

item.title: 'Most talked about thing in world football' - Newcastle's life after Isak
item.description: Newcastle United face Liverpool on Saturday for the first time since the injured Alexander Isak left the club in September following "the most talked about" saga in world football

item.title: Celtic to play Stuttgart & Forest face Fenerbahce in Europa play-offs
item.description: Celtic will play Stuttgart and Nottingham Forest will face Fenerbahce in two-legged play-offs to reach the last 16 of the Europa League.

item.title: West Ham's Paqueta completes £35.5m Flamengo move
item.description: West Ham midfielder Lucas Paqueta completes a £35.5m move to boyhood club Flamengo.

item.title: Fan group 'concerned' by ICE raids before World Cup
item.description: Fan group Football Supporters Europe (FSE) says it is "extremely concerned by the ongoing militarisation of police forces in the US" before this summer's World Cup in North America.

item.title: 'Barca move gave me confidence I could adapt'
item.description: Chelsea's Lucy Bronze - England's most decorated female footballer - tells BBC Sport's Emma Sanders that she "found even more confidence in myself" after leaving Manchester City in 2022.

item.title: 'I have my own opinion' - Slot responds to Liverpool criticism
item.description: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot admits he's aware of the "noise" around the club after just five wins in their past 18 Premier League matches, but refuses to define what an "acceptable" outcome to the season would look like to him.

item.title: Guardiola defends referee remarks after Wolves win
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola and a reporter share a heated exchange over comments he made about new Premier League referee Farai Hallam following Manchester City's 2-0 win over Wolves.

item.title: Barry goal rescues draw for Everton against Leeds
item.description: Watch Premier League highlights as Everton's Thierno Barry continues his good run of form with a second-half goal to earn the Toffees a 1-1 draw with Leeds United.

item.title: Palace could get dragged into this - Sutton
item.description: Chris Sutton tells the Monday Night Club that he believes Crystal Palace could be dragged into a relegation battle in the Premier League if they don't make a decision on manager Oliver Glasner soon.

item.title: Moyes praises Everton's 'much better' second half
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes praises a "much better" second-half display that saw French forward Thierno Barry equalise to give the Toffees a 1-1 Premier League draw with Leeds at the Hill Dickinson stadium.

item.title: Transfer market not like Football Manager - Frank
item.description: Thomas Frank says Tottenham trying to sign Antoine Semenyo is a sign of how committed the Lewis family are to improving the playing squad.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: Hibs bank club-record fee as Bowie joins Verona
item.description: Kieron Bowie becomes Hibernian's club-record sale after the Scotland striker joins Serie A side Hellas Verona on a four-and-a-half year deal.

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: Crystal Palace sign Villa forward Guessand on loan
item.description: Crystal Palace sign Aston Villa forward Evann Guessand on loan until the end of the season with the option to make the move permanent.

item.title: Why do teams have a 'bomb squad'?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what 'bomb squads' are in football and why they are used?

item.title: Hibs v Rangers, Maswanhise & Robinson - Scottish Premiership preview
item.description: Hibernian v Rangers, Motherwell forward Tawanda Maswanhise and St Mirren boss Stephen Robinson headline our Premiership preview.

item.title: 'Celtic coach phoned to say sorry for behaviour'
item.description: Heart of Midlothian manager Derek McInnes says Celtic assistant coach Mark Fotheringham called him to apologise for his behaviour at Tynecastle last weekend.

item.title: Fulham sign Man City winger Bobb for £27m
item.description: Fulham sign Norway winger Oscar Bobb from Manchester City for £27m on a five-and-a-half-year contract.

item.title: Football's 'Picasso' Robertson honoured at funeral
item.description: John Robertson was a key part of Brian Clough's Nottingham Forest teams that won the European Cup.

item.title: West Ham loan offer for Harwood-Bellis rejected
item.description: West Ham have a loan offer for Southampton defender Taylor Harwood‑Bellis rejected.

item.title: Can you name every team still in the Champions League?
item.description: The Champions League knockout phase gets under way with the play-off first legs on 17 and 18 February - can you name all 24 teams still in the competition?

item.title: Arteta 'begs' Premier League for bigger match squads
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Premier League match squads should increase in size from 20 to 23 players to preserve the "value and mental health of players".

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: A 10-point lead cut to three - is it just a blip for Coventry?
item.description: With their Championship lead down to three points how worried should Coventry City fans be about a potential promotion meltdown?

item.title: How do Liverpool fix their struggles against low blocks?
item.description: Why are Liverpool struggling against low blocks in the Premier League, how are they trying to unlock them and what could they do better?

item.title: Journalist dreams & Keane reunion? How O'Neill continues to revive Celtic
item.description: Showman Martin O'Neill continues to thrive as Celtic's interim manager as he guides the club through to the Europa League play-off round.

item.title: Who is 'shy and nervous' Villa match-winner Jimoh-Aloba?
item.description: Aston Villa match-winner Jamaldeen Jimoh-Aloba is described as "shy and nervous" by Morgan Rogers - but the teenager announced himself on the European stage.

item.title: Why have English teams dominated as Real & PSG face play-offs?
item.description: Five of the eight teams to qualify automatically for the Champions League were from the Premier League, so why have they been so dominant?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Why do Premier League teams spend less in January?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why clubs spend significantly more on new signings in the summer than they do in the January transfer window.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who do Arsenal play in final?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: 'Hoffenheim bid for £6m-rated Wilson from Aston Villa' - gossip
item.description: Scotland Under-21 forward Rory Wilson is reportedly interesting Hoffenheim as Wolverhampton Wanderers are said to be eyeing Che Adams while Celtic and Rangers continue to court a variety of forward options.

item.title: Why La Liga title race is back on
item.description: A slip from Barcelona and a resurgent Real Madrid means the title race is back on in La Liga.

item.title: Who can join Aston Villa in Europa League last 16?
item.description: Aston Villa are through to the Europa League last 16 already - but with one round of matches to play in the league phase, only two of the other three British sides have a chance of joining them.

item.title: Musiala set for Bayern return six months after leg break
item.description: Jamal Musiala is set to return to the Bayern Munich squad seven months after suffering a leg break at the Club World Cup.

item.title: Rado Vidosic was 'one of the most incredible men'
item.description: Brighton interim manager Chris Roberts described Rado Vidosic as "one of the most incredible men" he has ever met, following the death of the club's head of women's coaching.

item.title: Arsenal in talks to sign Barcelona's Batlle in summer
item.description: Arsenal have held advanced discussions with Barcelona full-back Ona Batlle in the hope of reaching a pre-contract agreement to sign her in the summer.

item.title: 'When something needs doing, people say to just ask Lucy'
item.description: England and Chelsea defender Lucy Bronze speaks to BBC Sport about finding more confidence with age and why chasing titles is more exciting.

item.title: Bompastor tracks back on WSL title 'gone' comments
item.description: Chelsea manager Sonia Bompastor has tracked back on her comments saying the WSL title is "probably over" by insisting her side will "never give up".

item.title: What awaits interim boss Lindsay in NI job?
item.description: BBC Sport NI looks at some of the issues Northern Ireland's incoming interim boss Kris Lindsay will look to address before World Cup 2027 qualifying begins in March.

item.title: Man City's Casparij on Manchester, cats and being mistaken for a gardener
item.description: In BBC Sport's Eat & Yap series, Alex Scott meets some of the best WSL players to share the food they love and to chat about life on and off the pitch.

item.title: US striker Dunn retires from professional football
item.description: US forward Crystal Dunn, 33, has called time on her professional career after more than a decade at the top of women's football.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
